name: Hilton Irvine/Orange County Airport

reviews.text: Hotel was decent for an overnight before a flight or if you were just in town for one or two days on business. Nothing special here. Just a bed and decent breakfast. One of my associates stayed at the "other" Hilton in the area which had a much more "resort" and "vacation" feel. Was not really relevant to me, but is certainly the additional amenities would be something I would like if I were choosing again.
reviews.title: decent for an overnight but not a place for more than 2 days

reviews.text: My only real complaint is that the staff went overboard in asking for me to include them by name in my review. I understand that they receive compensation for being specifically named in a positive review, but I found it tacky for them to solicit guests to include them in our reviews. Almost seems like a waiter telling you how good his service was and asking for a big tip. Some may not have an issue with this, but I personally found it tacky.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: My family and I we are so placed with Hilton Irvine hotel staff, they are so kind and so professional
reviews.title: Personnel at the buffett Breakfast area ROCKS

reviews.text: Ruben the waiter of the restaurant did a great job and the food is very good out there.
reviews.title: A great stay

reviews.text: We had all the time correct information and an excellent customer service.
reviews.title: Santa Ana Business Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night - it was a very good choice!
reviews.title: A very good choice

reviews.text: Good Rate, friendly Ceck-In, nice quiet room and an excellent breakfast-buffet in the morning!
reviews.title: Trapped in the overpriced parking lot.

reviews.text: (There is no lounge and so we got vouchers for the buffet)
reviews.title: Fantastic Customer Service!

reviews.text: A very good staff and service everywhere!
reviews.title: 2nd time here, I'd go back again

reviews.text: But: Parking 18 Dollars on the other side of the street ist too expensive !
reviews.title: The best hotel, if you ignore parking, which I could not.

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hilton Irvine while attending meetings at UC Irvine. The hotel is comfortable, service is good and friendly. Breakfast buffet (free for HH Golds) is okay but pretty ordinary.
reviews.title: Comfortable standard Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an older Hilton, probably from the 1960s but is well maintained and recently fairly recently.
reviews.title: Above average US Hilton

reviews.text: Although quite close to the airport, the Hilton Irvine/Orange County Airport has good sound-proofing so you could get a quiet sleep. The room is the usual standard fare for Hitlon in the U.S. with the E&C bath products, nice clean room.
reviews.title: A beautiful property, well located, good for business

reviews.text: What it lacks in charms, it made it up in comfort and price. The staff at the front desk is hit&miss. You can find some cold yet others particularly the younger staff friendly and helpful. I can't put my finger on it though. I chose this hotel because I have an early flight out on the morning of the departure day. I am not sure if I wanted to be here if I was on vacation. Although, getting out of the mess in Anaheim is not a bad idea. For guests who has business around the area, it is a decent choice.
reviews.title: Hilton-Orange County Airport

reviews.text: I like the Irvine Hilton, I,ve stayed there before. If I,d reviewed it then I would have rated it at a five. It's an unusually attractive hotel with a great location and excellent staff, with one rather glaring exception. We had arrived, spent the first night gone to an all day meeting etc. when I arrived back at my room my key card did not work. I went down to the front desk only to be basically verbally assaulted by the extremely rude and very odd front desk manager. She was in a rather hysterical state because it seems one of her employees (a very nice young man) had wrongly allowed me to check in the day before using my credit card which had my new last name on it which didn't match my drivers license ( just married-hadn't gone to DMV yet). I was bored and annoyed by her, so she then stated in front of myself and several other guests that the young man in question "was in a lot of trouble" because according to her the Irvine Hilton is some sort of underground abused women's shelter and "this sort of thing endangers them." All in all it was such a weird off putting experience that I can't imagine staying there again.
reviews.title: Excellent comfortable stay, service was amazing!

reviews.text: The hotel was nicely furnished but no refrigerator...one was available for a daily charge of $5.00 which is not very accommodating...I should not have to pay an additional 5.00 to have a refrigerator. But, we had cheese, yogurt and wine to keep cold so I asked for one and the staff brought it right away It was plugged in and sounded like it went on but the next morning when i took out the yogurt, it was warm and the cheese smell was very strong. The front desk staff took the charge off but it was inconvenient that the refrigerator did not work after all that extra work.
reviews.title: Helpful s

reviews.text: Why not just raise the rate $5. to cover the refrigerator? I feel that every room should have one, it should be part of the room. Otherwise, the room was big enough, nicely furnished and had everything else needed. Pool was nice. Had the breakfast buffet, was tasty, good choices.
reviews.title: Great value & wonderful staff

reviews.text: All in all, a good stay.
reviews.title: Almost a smooth landing

reviews.text: We stayed here while we were in the Whitaker Wellness Institute Program (who selected the hotel). Room was nice staff did a great job - always felt cared for & valued. The location is great - literally 5 min. from the John Wayne Airport, yet the hotel is very quiet. Although the building is older, the rooms were updated and the lobby is very nice also. Obviously not a 5-star, but definitely surpassed our expectations.
reviews.title: Musical Toilets

reviews.text: My family and I visited this hotel and booked two rooms. Location is very convenient to the Orange County Airport, just literally across MacArthur Boulevard, maybe a five minute drive to/from airport. The front desk was cordial and check in was smooth. We were assigned to two adjoining rooms, one with a king bed and one with two doubles. Rooms were large approximately 350 square feet with dated furnishings and a noisy hvac individual unit mounted on the wall, circa 1980's. A mild caveat is intrusion of air traffic noise for light sleepers due to proximity to airport.
reviews.title: Great Stay

description: The Hilton Irvine/Orange County Airport is centrally located in the heart of Orange County and located near many attractions, shopping centers, and restaurants.Use the complimentary shuttle from Orange County John Wayne Airport. We provide a comfortable setting for any event and welcome the opportunity to welcome your family or group. Equipped with outdoor pool, fitness center, Aura Bar and Grill, this Irvine hotel offers luxury accomodations and expert service for your leisure or corporate stay.
